Explanation.name: Notes on screen widgets
Explanation.description: - the widget coordinate system is a left-handed system (+x to the right, +y up, +z into the screen) with the origin centered in the display (regardless of display size) - for widget component placement, all coordinates you define in the tag specifiy the object's placement prior to the application of any animation - all coordinates you define are local to that object - all text specific to objects in the screen comes from the screen's string list tag all of the string indices you may need to specify will refer to the screen's string list tag - a pane may contain either buttons OR a list OR a table-view, but never a combination of those (widget won't function correctly if you try that) - all text is centered unless you specify otherwise

Explanation.name: Flags
Explanation.description: Set misc. screen behavior here

Bit.name: multiple panes are for list flavor items

Enum.name: Edit Jug Pts for Killing Jugger
Edit CTF Flag at Home to Score
Edit Assault Enemy Flag at Home to Score
Edit Indicator Players on Motion Sensor
Edit Indicator Invisible Players on Motion Sensor

Explanation.name: Button Key
Explanation.description: The labels here are just a guide; the actual string used comes from the Nth position of this button key entry as found in the ui globals button key string list tag

Explanation.name: Default Text Color
Explanation.description: Any ui elements that don't explicitly set a text color will use this color

Explanation.name: Screen Text
Explanation.description: All text specific to this screen

Explanation.name: Panes
Explanation.description: Define the screen's panes here (normal screens have 1 pane, tab-view screens have 2+ panes)

Explanation.name: Button Definitions
Explanation.description: If the pane contains buttons, define them here

Explanation.name: List Definition
Explanation.description: If the pane contains a list, define it here

Explanation.name: Item Text Value Pairs
Explanation.description: If you want to control item text-value pairing manually, add them here.

Explanation.name: OBSOLETE
Explanation.description: this is all obsolete

Explanation.name: Value
Explanation.description: Enter the value in the box corresponding to the value type you specified above

Explanation.name: Text Label
Explanation.description: This is text string associated with data when it has the value specified above. The string comes from the screen's string list tag.

Explanation.name: OBSOLETE Table View Definition
Explanation.description: If the pane contains a table-view, define it here

Explanation.name: Flavor Item Blocks
Explanation.description: Define additional flavor items here

Explanation.name: Text-Value Pair Blocks
Explanation.description: If you need general purpose text-value pairs for the contents of this pane, define them here. NOTE: special code will be needed to hook these into anything. They are useful for things such as custom text labels that change depending on the currently selected list item, or current value of some game setting. Thanks, have a nice day. -Stefan

Explanation.name: OBSOLETE
Explanation.description: this is all obsolete

Explanation.name: Shape Group
Explanation.description: If the screen is to have a shape group, specify it here (references group in user interface globals tag)

Explanation.name: More Screen Parameters
Explanation.description: These are down here because they got added on later. Have a nice day.

Explanation.name: Local strings
Explanation.description: String IDs here allow defining new string ids that are visible only to this screen.

Explanation.name: Local bitmaps
Explanation.description: Bitmaps here allow adding a bitmap that's accessible in code for use in this screen.

Explanation.name: LEVEL LOAD PROGRESS FIELDS
Explanation.description: These are used only for level load progress bitmaps

Explanation.name: Mouse cursors
Explanation.description: The mouse cursor definition for this screen.
